item.title: What Zaima chose to examine
item.description: POLITICAL speeches usually arrive with expectations already fixed. Either they rehearse loyalty, perform outrage or attempt to establish authority through lineage and certainty. Zaima Rahman’s first policy-level speech did none of them. That alone made it noteworthy. But what made it politically interesting was not simply what she said, but what she chose to foreground and what she deliberately left unresolved......

item.title: Triangles, tensions and tactical trade-offs
